definition: a fish that escaped the net (idiom)/(fig.) sb or sth that slips through the net
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)

sentences.english: The fairy as the light of escape fish, play with us!
sentences.chinese: 这漏网之鱼般的光的精灵，和我们一起游戏。

sentences.english: The police arrested most of the gangsters, but there were stell stragglers.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了大部分的歹徒，但仍有漏网之鱼。

sentences.english: This lets you spot any structures you may have overlooked in the corners of the map.
sentences.chinese: 这可以让你看到任何你没看过的角落是否有漏网之鱼。

definition: remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to hunt and arrest (fugitives)/to track down and arrest/a manhunt
submerged piles installed to prevent the passage of boats/(fig.) informer/spy
lit. to catch everything in the one net (idiom)/fig. to scoop up the whole lot/to capture them all in one go
